dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Brief
dataObjects.description: "Red List Category & Criteria: Least Concern ver 3.1 Year Assessed: 2010 Assessor/s: Anitha, K. Reviewer/s: Rasingam, L., Raghavan, R., Daniel, B.A. & Gunaga, S. Contributors: Molur, S. Justification: Hygrophila difformisÊis widely distributed and is without threats, hence assessed as Least Concern. Conservation Actions: There is no conservation action known or needed for the species."

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Miscellaneous Details
dataObjects.description: Hygrophila difformis is similar to H. balsamica but leaf blades of emergent stems elliptical to ovate.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.title: Distribution
dataObjects.description: "Range Description: Hygrophila difformis is known from India, Mayanmar, Bangladesh and Nepal.Ê In India it is reported from Kerala, Uttar Pradesh and West BengalÊ(Cook 1996). Countries -  Native: Bangladesh; India (Kerala, Uttar Pradesh, West Bengal); Myanmar; Nepal"

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Habitat
dataObjects.title: General Habitat
dataObjects.description: "Habitat and Ecology: It is perennial or annual. Usually found in shallow water where it may be bottom-rooted or straggling over the surface (Cook 1996). Systems: Freshwater List of Habitats: 5, 5.2"
